titles.title: American Indian Religious Freedom Act Amendments of 1994
To provide for the management of Federal lands in a manner that does not undermine or frustrate traditional Native American religions or religious practices.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E566)
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Hearings Held by the Subcommittee on Native American Affairs Prior to Referral.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Native American Affairs.

bill.summary: 3/24/1994--Introduced. American Indian Religious Freedom Act Amendments of 1994 - Requires Federal agencies to plan and manage their lands in ways that do not undermine or frustrate a traditional Native American religion or religious practice.
